meanings.definition: A method of combining multiple signals into one signal for transmission.
meanings.sent1: Multiplexing allows different signals to be merged into a single transmission.
meanings.sent2: The technician used multiplexing to send various signals through one cable.
meanings.sent3: The party invitation was like multiplexing different guests into one event.
meanings.sent4: Her painting technique was a form of multiplexing colors to create a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: In the library of sounds, multiplexing is the DJ mixing different tracks seamlessly.

meanings.definition: The simultaneous transmission of multiple signals over a single channel.
meanings.sent1: With multiplexing, several signals can travel together through one pathway.
meanings.sent2: During the broadcast, multiplexing allowed the radio station to air multiple programs at once.
meanings.sent3: The traffic jam was like multiplexing cars on a narrow road.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, multiplexing joy and excitement.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was a clever form of multiplexing different objects into one hat.

meanings.definition: The process of sharing a communication channel among multiple users.
meanings.sent1: Multiplexing ensures fair access to the communication channel for all users.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, multiplexing allowed everyone to speak on the conference call.
meanings.sent3: The potluck dinner was a fun way of multiplexing different dishes among friends.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style was like multiplexing responsibilities among team members.
meanings.sent5: In the world of online gaming, multiplexing ensures smooth communication between players.
